Articles.Content: hi ! Does anyone made something for a better looking laythe ?

hi ! Does anyone made something for a better looking laythe ?
Check the reddit subforum link on the first post. I especially recommend Tingle's pack --- mix and match the HD and SD versions based on how much free memory you have.
Nova said he planned a retexture for Tylo to make it look like Iapetus. Since I'm impatient and the devs have other priorities, I did it myself:
Just posting to say thanks to everyone who contributed. This is a simple change to the game but has made it that much nicer to look at. Keep up the great work.

Celestial Bodies Revamped

Celestial Bodies Revamped HD part1

Celestial Bodies Revamped HD part2

Please answer, did anyone actually was able to correctly download files of HD version? I've been tryed it dozens times and always system not recognize files as archives...

Can anyone help me?

Also I notice some defect on revamped textures of regular resolution:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

hello,

has anyone created textures to replace every planet in ksp universe ( kerbin, jool, mun, e.t.c ) with the textures of planets from our solar system. ( earth, moon, mars, saturn, uranus, e.t.c )

Cheers, Ryan.
I don't think so, because all UP does is change the textures while high up and on map view. Once you get below a certain altitude the planets are the same as without UP.

I've noticed a few others in this thread mention that there's been a huge FPS drop in version 4.0. I'm finding the same problem in my build, but I'm surprised everyone isn't mentioning it. Maybe it's an issue with running the mod on Linux -- who knows.

I wanted to find out if there's any way the OP or anyone else can release version 3.2 again? I'm just interested in running skybox and Kerbin textures, nothing fancy. 3.2 worked great on my build before, if I remember correctly.
Same for me. And really, nobody is discussing it or searching for a way to fix it. Even the mod author. Seems like everyone is content running their little kerbal suits and no other mods at all.
Not everyone's having it. I'm running a Kerbin/Eve/Laythe retexture with a different starfield and spacesuits, and I'm not having any problems at all. Other than memory overload crashes...

Nova said he planned a retexture for Tylo to make it look like Iapetus. Since I'm impatient and the devs have other priorities, I did it myself:

Damn. That's nice. I can see the Iapetus in it without it veering to far from the look of the game. Are you planning on releasing it?
Is it possible to add city lights with this mod? They would be visible only from orbit like clouds, but also only on the night side of Kerbin. Anyone gave it any thought?

Is it possible to add city lights with this mod? They would be visible only from orbit like clouds, but also only on the night side of Kerbin. Anyone gave it any thought?

Yeah, I'd been thinking about that a while ago. Though I can't figure out how it would be possible without it being visible during the day as well. I wouldn't be surprised if it is possible though.
Hmmm, another obstacle would be oceans. It would look silly if we could see a huge, bright metropolis in the middle of the sea.
Does anyone know why this crashes with Mac OSX?

I want to make a file the same way you are here, but I'm confused about how you did it. When I open the PNG's in photoshop, I just get a picture of the ocean. I don't see any more layers and I'm fairly confused, because the game uses it just fine as you said, but it doesn't help me when I try to do the same sort of thing for Eve...

-snip-

This is sort of what I have going on for Eve, I'm not really sure if the land mass is correct because I'm basing it off of one of those textures where I can't see all the layers in photoshop. I assume it's right, but I don't have anything capable of landing there right now to check. Seems to look okay in game, but I was gonna launch a mission to Eve first to see how it actually works colorwise and land-wise. If anyone wants it before then, I'll put it up right away though.

Out of curiosity, how's your progress on this? I'm really looking forward to it! And I downloaded the really low res one you posted right there and downloaded it, and it lines up with the terrain, so it's good to go.

I don't understand what the point of this universe replacer is, seeing as it only replaces textures on map / high altitude the ground mass doesn't physically change.

maybe this is something the dev's of mod can work on?

cheers, Ryan.
It's for when you want better and more realistic looking planets. Also, you can change the textures for Kerbals themselves!

I don't understand what the point of this universe replacer is, seeing as it only replaces textures on map / high altitude the ground mass doesn't physically change.

maybe this is something the dev's of mod can work on?

cheers, Ryan.

Although pretty graphics are not the point of KSP, they can add to the experience. I would not mind a full on space simulator, so more realistic graphics are a nice touch to increase immersion.

Just wanted to thank Robau for "Swirly Jool", particularly how he handled the storms - to me, the Red Spot is so uniquely Jupiter that seeing it on other gas giants spoils my immersion and/or makes me think that all the creator did was take a stock map or texture for Jupiter, greyscale it, and then tint it some other color. His version has a plausibly similar, but clearly not just recolored feature.

Download

I know that some people think that Rareden's HD skybox is a bit too colorful or color-saturated. Additionally, I personally found recognizing distinct astronomical objects to be a bit immersion-breaking. If you like the original HD skybox but want something anonymized and a little more subdued, give this a try

Full Changelog:

-Greatly reduced the overall color saturation. Some color is still there, but it's not bright orange-blue

-Removed the Pleiades

-Removed Andromeda

-Removed the Magellanic Clouds

-Removed the Orion constellation and nebula

-Added a bright constellation near the celestial north pole

-Added a distinctive nebula near the south pole

-Cleaned up some overly-bright foreground stars

Distributed with permission

Edited September 18, 2013 by Zeroignite

Can someone make Kerbin look like this?
can anyone make it look like that please?
No. This mod only changes the distant view of planets, i.e. how they look when you're at least in low orbit. Also that screenshot is from an ancient version of the game.
